result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Michael W Johnson was found guilty of OWI (5th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Prior to re-licensing the defendant is to complete an OWI Assessment.

miscConds.notes: Fine to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.
Same repayment conditions as noted above for the fine.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

timeConds.notes: Defendant is entitled to Good Time Credit and Huber Privileges. The Court has no objection to the sentence being served in another jurisdiction.  ***The Court approves work release privileges for employment in Winnebago Co.***  Sentence to commence forthwith.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 3:03 p.m. Defendant Michael W Johnson in court with attorney Raymond l Edelstein.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin. The Court entertains waiver of the preliminary hearing. The Court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant BOT. Information filed by DA Blader. Receipt admitted - Reading waived.   Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: Ct 1 - NC. Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Ct 2 - Dismissed outright. 16TR227 - DRI. Sentencing argument by DA Blader. Sentencing argument by Atty Edelstein. Statement by DE. Court orders: S/W 30 mos probation - Conditions: 11 mos WC Jail - Huber, GT, No CFTS - Sentence to commence forthwith, the Court has no objection to the sentence being served in another jurisdiction, $2500 fine inclusive of costs w/ 60 DTP or PP, 33 mos DL rev/33 mos IID, $42.50 Blood Draw Cost w/ 60 DTP or PP, OWI Assessment, AODA and follow through, DE must maintain absolute sobriety, DE may not be present upon the premises of any bars, DE prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician, DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Appeal rights given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 10, 2016 at 02:45 pm.

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 1:12 PM:  Defendant Michael W Johnson in court with attorney Raymond l Edelstein.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Amended Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive time limits for preliminary hearing. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of 20 day time limits for preliminary hearing.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for April 20, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Restitution Summary - $110.57
Adjourned initial appearance at 03-29-2016 01:15 pm

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.  No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.   Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

16CF-20 and 16TR-227 - Both Cases Called @ 3:37 PM: Defendant Michael W Johnson in court, appearing pro se.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.     Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wants counsel and plans to retain his own counsel.  Requests slight extension to obtain counsel - approx one month.  Court will proceed with the understanding that he will retain his own counsel.  ADA argues as to bond - $3000 Signature Bond w/conditions.  No statement as to bond request.  AIA Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  NGP entered as to companion citation and to track along with the criminal proceeding.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for March 29, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
